intro: Gilia pinnatifida, commonly known as the fringed gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from pink to purple. Its leaves are pinnately divided, giving it a delicate, fern-like appearance. Gilia pinnatifida thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands.
